body_html:
So here is my progress. My macbook pro is gone, due to old age, but these I was able to figure out in its last breath:
The need to create /usr/local/cuda/lib/libcuda.1.dylib should now be gone if you use TF from head or TF 1.1 (rc at the moment).

LD_LIBRARY_PATH I did not need to set at all to get TF to run.
DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH, this was bad. I got everything to work with this aggressive variable:

export DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH=/Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0:/Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0/lib:/usr/local/cuda:/usr/local/cuda/lib:$DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH

body:
So here is my progress. My macbook pro is gone, due to old age, but these I was able to figure out in its last breath:
The need to create `/usr/local/cuda/lib/libcuda.1.dylib` should now be gone if you use TF from head or TF 1.1 (rc at the moment).

`LD_LIBRARY_PATH` I did not need to set at all to get TF to run.
`DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH`, this was bad. I got everything to work with this aggressive variable:
```
export DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH=/Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0:/Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0/lib:/usr/local/cuda:/usr/local/cuda/lib:$DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH
```
